Package de.hshl.obj.loader.objects

Class TriangularMesh

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.hshl.obj.meta.Reflective.DataClass
      • de.hshl.obj.loader.objects.TriangularMesh
  • public class TriangularMesh
extends Reflective.DataClass
    Contains geometry, made of triangular vertices. May contain indices to vertices. Also supports converting from OBJ data to OpenGL-friendly data.
    Author:
    Johannes Vollmer

    • Field Summary

    • Field Detail

      • vertices

        public final float[] vertices
        Contains all vertex data: position, texture coordinates, and normals if they were loaded. Example: [p0,p1,p2, t0,t1, n0,n1,n2, ... ]
        See Also:
        containsNormals, containsTextureCoordinates

      • containsTextureCoordinates

        public final boolean containsTextureCoordinates
        True, if the vertices contain texture coordinates.

      • containsNormals

        public final boolean containsNormals
        True, if the vertices contain normals.

      • indices

        @Nullable
public final int[] indices
        The triangle faces in this mesh, referencing vertices. Null if no indices were loaded.
        See Also:
        OBJLoader.useIndexedVertices(boolean)

      • extract

        public static TriangularMesh extract​(FloatVectors positions,
                                     @Nullable
                                     FloatVectors textureCoordinates,
                                     @Nullable
                                     FloatVectors normals,
                                     IntegerVectors indices,
                                     IndexRange indicesSection,
                                     boolean outputIndexed)
        Extract a Triangular Mesh from the given vertex data, merging indices if required. The resulting mesh will always be an independent object and not modify or reference any argument.

      • mergeVertexIndices

        public static TriangularMesh mergeVertexIndices​(FloatVectors positions,
                                                @Nullable
                                                FloatVectors textureCoordinates,
                                                @Nullable
                                                FloatVectors normals,
                                                IntegerVectors indices,
                                                IndexRange indicesSection)
        OBJ vertices have a separate index for positions, texture coordinates, and normals independently. In OpenGL, a single index points to all of the above. Vertices that are only partially equal are allowed in OBJ, but must be made a separate vertex for OpenGL. This method merges the indices of OBJ de.hshl.obj.data by collapsing them into a single index per vertex. This method is more expensive than 'flatten', but the resulting PolygonMesh probably uses less memory in Java and OpenGL. Also cuts out the specified section from the indices, the new indices will be starting from 0. Texture Coordinates and Normals may be null.

      • flatten

        public static TriangularMesh flatten​(FloatVectors positions,
                                     @Nullable
                                     FloatVectors textureCoordinates,
                                     @Nullable
                                     FloatVectors normals,
                                     IntegerVectors indices,
                                     IndexRange indicesSection)
        Converts indexed vertices to plain, redundant vertices. Makes referenced vertices unique by inserting copies of them. The indices array of the resulting Mesh will be null. Texture coordinates and normals may be null.
